Reviews.Title: “Mixed review.”
Reviews.Author: AylaDallas
Reviews.Content: First, our beds were very comfortable and we slept well each night. My friend and I were there for 3 nights, 2 queen beds. No bugs. Room was cleaned nicely each day. On the downside, it can be noisy when people are coming/going, there's only one person in the office at any time, and you need to go to the office to retrieve anything extra you might need, like towels. It took 30 minutes to check out because there were 2 people ahead of us and only 1 employee. You get the usual tiny soaps, so we were glad we brought our own. The coffee tray in the vanity area was refilled every day, and the pot cleaned. Yes, it's near the "adult" entertainment section, but there are many hotels in this area. It's a popular area due to the proximity to the bay. The wifi was up and down. Inconsistent. Saw people in the pool, but we didn't use the pool. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it, but I wouldn't stay to avoid it either. If you're on a budget, this place is okay. Looks nothing like the picture, however.

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest place I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Everything bad anyone has written about this place is true. Seedy neighborhood. The first clue was the bars on the check-in window, not to mention the vagrants, prostitutes and adult bookstores. The pictures are very deceiving. This place is dirty, smelly and scary. My wife was afraid to walk the dog outside. The "breakfast" was also terrible. Day old stale pastries. Lousy coffee. Not even a piece of fruit. I always read reviews before booking, but I've never written a review before. If I can save just one person from this experience, I will consider it my one good deed of the decade. Trust me-STAY AWAY. There are plenty of other decent places at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not as bad as some make out.”
Reviews.Author: Sophie A
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review of this place because some of the older reviews are a bit outdated (I think). We just got back from staying here and I was very wary of the place based on previous reviews. Really, it is not that bad. No, it's not a 5-star hotel but what do you expect for the price? There is a lobby where you check-in during normal hours - the glass window is for late check-ins which is pretty standard at a cheaper hotel. Our room was clean and had the added bonus of a fridge. The breakfast was a variety of pastries which were ok. If you're travelling with a dog you can't beat the location as it is sooo close to Fiesta Island (amazing off leash dog park) and just across the street from Camp-Run-A-Mutt for doggy day care (if, like us, you don't want to leave your dog in your room all day while you do things without them). The only thing is it is hard to find information on their pet policy online which makes it seem like they don't charge for pets - they do, it is $15 per day. The location is not at all sketchy, I saw one review where the person complained about the number of RV's parked on the street. That's because there's an RV service garage just around the corner from the hotel! I did not observe any drug related behavior from anyone in the neighborhood - the hotel is right next to an 'active seniors' condo complex! I felt pretty safe while staying there and I am 6 months pregnant so do take extra precautions. Anyway, I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone looking to save a few bucks on a centrally located hotel in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you want to pick up a cocaine addiction.”
Reviews.Author: Gage_12
Reviews.Content: My wife,son and I decided we would book this hotel for our trip to seaworld,The price was good..But thats where the good experience ended,when we first came to check in,there was no lobby,and nothing but a very rude woman,behind bulletproof glass to check in with. It was extremely seedy,nothing about the place felt safe,and I didnt feel comfertable having my son spend the night there. The only people who are staying here,clearly LIVE here,because they have most likely been kicked out of there previous resident for DRUG POSSESSION,we checked out 15 minutes after we checked in,and were refused a refund,we decided to dish out the money and stay at the holiday inn across the street, completely OPPOSITE Experience,its worth the money to not step on used needles or get shot at. And on top of everything else,there were people standing in the parking lot, whistling at us and smoking weed when we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BizStudent2012
Reviews.Content: My school has gone to this hotel two years in a row for our spring break, and we have nothing but pro's! Great place to stay while your surfing and enjoying the beauty of Southern-California.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, But Kinda Sketchy :/”
Reviews.Author: marisa m
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancé stayed at this hotel the days of December 14-18. We had a late night check in due to our commute from Los Angeles to San Diego after work. We were waiting to check in, and there was a drunk man in line before us saying he was going to bring a woman from Mexico to stay with him. Hmmm, the sketchiness begins! Other than that, the check in was smooth. We fell asleep quickly that night, with the light on! There was no sign of bed bugs and it seemed clean. The beds were actually pretty comfy but the smell of the linen and pillows was very strong! The next night, the cops knocked on the door from our next door neighbors...at 3 in the morning!!! I bet it was that man with that woman from Mexico. But, that scared the crap out of me!!! Other than that, the room was nice and convenient for a little less than 50 bucks a day. Our four night stay was $222!!! what an amazing rate!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE ....”
Reviews.Author: Kaligirl00
Reviews.Content: We were going to be in town for one night and found this location for a cheap price through AAA. We requested a non smoking room, as I walked in thru the door the nasty odor of smoke smacked me in the face. I immediately turned on the ac and left for a night out in town hoping the smell eventually would go away. I came back and it was still the same, I was so fed up That I gathered my belonging to check out. I expressed my concerns to the receptionist at the front deck and she offered to upgrade my room. I wa so disgusted, there was no way I was sleeping there. I requested a refund but she told me that because I checked in at 4:00 pm and it was now 12:00 am she couldn't do it. I gave her the keys and walked away. Never will I ever stay here again and do not recommend it, spend the extra cash for something decent.

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: Junky87
Reviews.Content: We were very close to cancelling our reservation before we checked in after reading some of the reviews other people had written. We decided not to and it was a good decision. Reception staff were very friendly; they even allowed us to check-in early. They were very helpful with directions too. Our room was good - very clean. There were a lot of families staying there while we were there. The area is a bit dodgy, but the hotel itself felt safe. Breakfast is only pastries but it was adequate. Some fresh fruit would have been a welcome addition. Good places to eat nearby and Sea World is only a 20 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: RaviKaur
Reviews.Content: When I walked into my room thought it was decent looking...searched for bed bugs ok fine didnt find any went to bed & slept good. Next morning, I wake up there was BED BUGS just walking around on the sheets I picked up the covers and saw little baby ones too!!! eeeekkkkkk called the office right then and they said they will give me a diff room for one more night for cheap...I LEFT !!! what makes you think the other rooms dont have any??!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting & Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: krista1328
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very frightening area. The lady in the office was outside texting, and smoking while my booking company was trying to reach them. It took over an hour for them to finally answer the phone. We needed two beds not just one. They said they did not have anymore rooms available. We lost almost $100, because they would not refund our first night. Thank goodness we drove instead of taking a shuttle or we would have been stranded! The rooms smelled really bad! We were in the room for two minutes, and ran out gasping for fresh air. Their pictures on the website looks nothing like the hotel. The parking lot looked very scary, I was afraid to park my car there. This hotel is rather expensive for the very low quality. Please stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Good to Say about This - STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: Denbro7
Reviews.Content: Carpets were dirty - took a shower, stepped on the carpet, went back in the bathroom and left a dirty footprint. Got locked out of our room and had to get new keys - twice. Had to check out a hairdryer; when I used it, I blew a breaker - twice. Air conditioner was LOUD and woke us up every time it kicked on. Our beds were like sleeping on the floor while our friends' beds in another room creased everyone to the middle. There are 2 pillows on a queen bed, each being 12 inches by 12. Used condoms in the parking lot. Breakfast is a plain, tasteless pastry. Cost was relatively inexpensive but still not worth staying in this poor quality of a hotel. Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Anyone giving this place a positive review is a drunk or druggie”
Reviews.Author: Notsogood60739
Reviews.Content: OK. Where do I begin? We arrive and the office has no bathroom for the public and directs my 7year old to a store across the street. We get into the room and the air conditioner is broken. During the time we are there we have a guy digging garbage out of the garbage bins. I can't let my kids go to the pool because there are people (about 15 people) doing beer bongs by the hot tub. I went with my son and people were eating in the hot tub dripping cheese, drinking beer and alcohol and smoking cigarettes. Yes there was a sign that stated it was not allowed but obviously not enforced. I called to ask a question about a local activity and the front desk said let me call you back but never did. 75% of the people I've seen or met on these grounds has had a beer or alcoholic drink in their hand (even at 8 am in the morning). The management is in the office texting instead of managing the grounds. It's filthy and rather frightening. People are living here (at the hotel) I'm not quite sure how that is working out but the doors of the rooms are often wide open with music, alcohol, swearing .... I haven't seen any drugs yet but I suspect it's just a matter of time. NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY!!!! BEWARE. If you are single or an alcoholic and just want to find a party-you will probably love it here. If you are a family looking to build family memories of a great vacation steer clear or be ready to spend some time teaching lots of lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, very confortable”
Reviews.Author: Pereira01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we got a very good promotional rate. It was such a great surprise. Room is big (actually the standard size for U.S motels), bed is excellent and there´s a coffee machine inside the room. Its very close to the highway but there´s no noise from the outside, except if you´re close to the pool area - anyway is not a big deal. Location is good, close tho the beaches and downtown, but only if you have a car - there´s no way to walk anywhere because of the highways and big avenues. Good enough for those in a roadtrip, no so worth it for the backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Convieniently located 4.4 miles from San Diego Int Airport.,. It was good for Me!.”
Reviews.Author: ICE54
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Heritage was close to perfect.... i have very few criticisms .. the room 341 was clean and user friendly.. and gradually (I'm a fella remember Ha ha) i noticed that you had provided for most things... Hair Dryer, Rack to dry things, Coffee maker, bed head lighting and switches.. yes all just okay... i liked that each day the Shampoo & lotions were re charged ..and i liked the 2 pastries allowed each morning.. quite a nice touch as the $60 per nite was very reasonable... I was also pleased I'd chosen The Heritage to stay at as once there i discovered i was within easy reach of all things .. the Pharmacy, the Banks, Restaurants, a nearby beach i actually walked to about 2 miles away and even a Friday Swap meet in the Sports Arena Car park only yards down the road.. which made me smile... so all in all I'd definitely re-book another time.. and the electronic door card lock were so convenient as opposed to bulky keys... Well done the Heritage.. Thank you!.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Louisianajean
Reviews.Content: Good clean room,excellent maid service close to everything,.....Note: the light switch as a reset button which can be used if the frdige apprears not to work..Also nice staff...I stayed June 14-21 with no complaints.....

Reviews.Title: “Stey At Your Own Risk”
Reviews.Author: mybaybee
Reviews.Content: Booked online where it said hot breakfast, when we checked in was told they served coffee n pastries in the lobby. Got to my room and the surrounding room was open loud drinking. Our key would not work, had to go back to the lobby window to get a different one. Room was single bed and I booked two! Smelled like liquor, was so stuffy, and the windows had mold growing around them. Never got around to even looking at the bathroom, we were in n out. Attempted to stay because it was only for one night and I had already paid for it but to get a two bedroom I had to move to a smoking room. Had two children with me and did not want to stay there. We walked down the side st to the Holiday Inn Express, booked a room and drove our car over. A thousand times better!!!!! I think I would rather sleep in my car than stay at the Heritage Inn. U get wat you pay for, its cheap for a reason, sometimes it is worth the extra $ to be comfortable and feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “OK FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: kftravels
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because Expedia offered a $50 credit on an Expedia Visa if we did. So for the price this room was okay. The layout is pretty typical. Tub/shower and toilet enclosed with sink outside the bathroom. We couldn't figure out how to turn on the refrigerator but it worked according to the lady at the front desk. The room looked somewhat recently remodeled. Not filthy but not exceptionally clean. But okay. The beds were comfortable, not too hard and not too soft. We were on the third floor in the non-smoking section and we didn't smell smoke in our room at all. We were awoken up by someone playing music with very heavy bass. We called the office and they had them turn it down. The continental breakfast is nothing more than coffee and pastries. The coffee is Farmers Brothers (not my favorite by a long shot, but free). The person checking us in did not give us the warmest of greetings. However, the morning we checked out there was a very happy, friendly woman. Didn't catch her name but she has long reddish hair. She changed our view of the hotel staff. The hotel is in a great location if you plan to go to Sea World or the Zoo. The neighborhood isn't the best but it certainly could be worse.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, clean.”
Reviews.Author: BoltzMan
Reviews.Content: The Heritage is what Hotwire gave us as a 2-star in the northside of San Diego. It's maybe 5 minutes from SeaWorld and also the Arena, and just off of I-8. We were attending a USMC Recruit Graduation, and it was a 5 minute drivfe to the Recruit Depot, which is adjacent to the airport, so it's a convenient location. Close to a lot of reasonable price restaurants and a CVS and strip mall. The room was a basic motel room, without frills other than ironing board, fridge and coffee maker. To get a hair dryer requires a deposit at the desk, which is awkward. Breakfast is very basic. But Hotwire gave it to us for about $50 so I did'nt expect much. Minor issue with the bath knob, which screeched if pulled to far out, in Room 111. Didn't check out the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dimitra_10
Reviews.Content: First they advertising this hotel having a Continental Breakfast included in the price (66.38USD per night for a double room). Finally there is no condinental Breakfast. Actually there is not even a place to have breakfast. The "breakfast" is served on the reception desk!!!!!! It consist of coffee and 2 pastries per person which is also written as an instruction!!!!! Nobody can eat more than this!!! Secondly they are totally unprofessional as they charged as for this room twice saying that we didn't show up!!!!!!!! OK this is at least rediculous...

Reviews.Title: “Just you typical run of the mill basic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ElainemBent
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for what we needed, just a place to sleep while passing through San Diego. But expense first night when booking in at 8pm was $73 for a queen room. Enquired in the morning about Sunday night and was told $60 for the same room, but when I told the lady that the king room was only $50 on line she let us keep tge queen for $50!

Reviews.Title: “If you can, choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRuFa
Reviews.Content: It's a poor hotel with little and old rooms with no amenities. The location is really near to SeaWorld, but the street where you come in to the hotel looks very threatening.

Reviews.Title: “Overflowing Toilets, Noisy, Dirty, Early Morning Wake Up By The POLICE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GibsonWexford
Reviews.Content: Worst "hotel" experience I have ever had stayed here whilst visiting friends in San Diego and chose this property and its location to them and nothing else stayed here for 8 nights. Upon returning to my room one evening I found my toilet overflowing I shut off the water myself and went to tell them at reception I was told there was no maintainece or cleaning staff available and was given towels to clean it myself the water overflowed out of the bathroom and into the main bedroom area 5 days later the carpet was still wet and uncleaned when I asked could i change rooms I was told there was none available. Room was dirty, one over the whole 8 days my bedding was not changed once despite being requested, walls paper thin, was awoken one morning at 8am by the police asking if i had heard anything going on down the hall the previous night, I am not sure what type of crime was committed but the room 3 doors down was sealed off and csi staff wre there for many hours overall avoid

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...FAR away !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaMary
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Sea World location yesterday. We were not happy with our stay, because we felt the Heritage Inn website was misleading. Our room was clean, but it looked nothing like what was featured on the Heritage Inn website. The area we had to drive through to reach the hotel was like a haven for graffitti & bums. We never felt unsafe inside our hotel room, but my husband would not let me leave the room after dark to get ice from the ice machine, because he did not feel it was safe for me to do so alone.. In retrospect, hit was probably a good decesion. Don't expect to get any sleep if there are a herd of elephants in the room above you during your stay either. I had to finally go up to the front office & request they send security officers to make the herd above me stop stomping around . It was so loud, it woke my 8 year old up at Midnight. The continental breakfast was a joke. It was a few pastries in a box one day, a few muffins the next. There was bottle of orange juice sitting on the counter top. One day it was in quart sized bottle & the next it was in a Tupperware type container. It was not even in a bowl of ice or anything like that! The coffee was in a pump top dispenser. As I said before...it was a freaking joke! We will not be recommending this hotel to anyone & we will not be returning to any Heritage Inn properties in the future. The beds were similar to sleeping on the hard ground when we go camping. Even the size of the parking spots were laughable. It is nearly impossible to manuver a medium sized vechile into a parking spot along the backside of this hotel property. The best part of our stay was the location & it's the proximity to everything we wanted to go see. I will be adding pictures of the room on both Trip Advisor & Expedia once I return home. As I said before, I do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank goodness I have a friend that lives in the San Diego area so that I did not have to subject my family to this hotel of horrors any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Juuls27
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel the night before. For only $50,00 for 2 :-) you shouldn't be expecting a lot. Rooms are ok. Nothing special, bit dirty. Location is no where near down town, for Sea World it's perfect. Area is a bit creepy, didn't feel safe at all. Blocked the doors at night with our suitcases...didn't sleep well because of the unsafe feeling. Lots of "special" people (permanently??) staying in the hotel, neighbourhood not to good.

Reviews.Title: “No complains”
Reviews.Author: wmarti31
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok for the value. Went there to attend a concert and to go to Sea World. This Hotel is very close to Sea World, and within walking distance of the Sport Arena (where we went to se the concert). It was a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: chris1916
Reviews.Content: This had to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Other than location (Sea World) I will never use this hotel again. I had planned on a 4 night stay, but after the first night and the smell of the room... I checked out. I went out and bought a can of air freshner to try and help the smell. No luck! The bedsheet was disgusting! Overall, I would really warn you not to stay here. There are nicer kept hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: esox_ch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not too expensive, quite well situated if you travel by car. Rooms were fine but sheets were a little dirty ... No internet access available but a little complementary breakfast (coffee,tea and some bakeries) is provided. There is also a pool but we didn't try it. A large free-parking was also available. Not too bad finally, it could have been a really great deal if the sheets were clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain....Great Location...Great Staff....BAD area ...Horor Elevator”
Reviews.Author: gwtza
Reviews.Content: Ey guys.....i know this is late..but heres my review a. Heritage Inn San Diego The place can be good or bad depending on what you are looking for. Although the hotel itself is okay...its the area that surrounds it that makes it....eerie. Right across the hotel..there is a grassy area...near dennys..and well..lots of bums in the street and weird people talking to themselves hang out there. But in the 4 nights i stayed in the area...and DO take note that i walk to and from the area Every night ALONE around 11pm....nothings happened to me. Its just really creepy when you have to pass by a bum in the street whos talking to himself. Looking at the hotel itself...its pretty clean..no complaints...Staff are VERY nice and helpful. Area is superrrrrrrr great! near the beach...near bus stops....and not too far from gaslamp quarter which was hella fun. And it is VERY affordable. I kinda feel sorry for this hotel actuallly...because the hotel itself is not bad..and the location is good too. But its the area surrounding it that makes it creepy. Rest assured though..the cops are DEFINITLY on watch. i saw the police come by the hotel TWICE! One guy was caught getting a hooker. Tips if u decide to stay: 1. Get a room that is on the lower floor..Because the elevator is CRAP! it smells like pi$s...the lights flicker..and its superr slow. (think horror movie elevator scene) 2. If u want to avoid the creepy surroundings..just mjake sure u have a car. Theres no where really to hang out at night anyway in that area. 3. Its cheap..so dont expect 5 star cleanliness. There was NOTHING dirty about my room...but obviously it doesnt have that spark nice hotels has. 4. IF you are truly on a budget..go for it. But the holidayy inn express right beside it doesnt look so bad either. Have fun! SD is my favorite place in the states!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget choice”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: For San Diego this Motel gives you good value for money. Its clean, the rooms have fridges, it provides a little breakfast (if it hasn't run out!) and is convenient for Sea World (5 minutes drive away) and the Interstate (just off I8). It also has a reasonable sized pool. The area has quite a few restaurants nearby. The only downside wasa very stroppy man who checked us in. Even though it said 3pm check in and we were there at 3.10pm he got stroppy with everyone in the line and just said he was not checking anyone in until 4pm. I think he was a little stressed as he had been let down by the cleaning staff and others who worked there, however he shouldn't have taken it out on us! We had just had a long drive from Palm Springs. When we returned at just after 4 he was very cheerful pleasant and polite so I guess something really had upset him earlier

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with a good price”
Reviews.Author: canada75
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it has a good location and was one of the cheapest rates I found in all San Diego. I was using public transit while in town and the Premier was just off a bus route with frequent service throughout the day ( route 8/9 get off at the Red Lobster past the Sports Arena) This made it easy to get to Mission Beach, Lo Jolla, Sea World, Old Town and Downtown or even Tijuana on the Trolley from the nearby Old Town Station. Many fast food options and supermarkets nearby. The hotel itself is nothing special, smallish room, spartan appearance, only two small pillows on the bed - but nothing to complain about for the price. The only thing I did find annoying was that when a neighbor's door slammed shut it shook my room too. For the budget traveler looking for a basic place to stay I would recommend the Premier Inn Sports Arena. BTW don't miss checking out Kobey's Swap Meet every Fri-Sun just down the street at the Sports Area.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Excalibur13
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too pleased with the roaches that were crawling over everything at night and having to pay an extra $9.99 per day for wireless internet. Upon checkout they wanted to charge me 25 cents per local call, even though the phone placard said no charge for local calls and nothing else in the room made mention of it. And the checkout time posted on the room door was incorrect. I was told that what is posted on all hotel room doors is never correct.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable,Clean & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: arosa62
Reviews.Content: Budget conscious,I researched many hotels on line for price and positive feedbacks before I booked. I'm posting to assist other travelers looking for good deals. Area was okay - walking distance to Dennys, Red Lobster & other food places. Room was clean,fridge included & comfy beds,buidling well cared for! I saved extra using my AAA. No need to pay Fancy Hotel prices unless you plan in staying in your room all day! Heck you're in San Diego, you'll have extra money to go Sea World 5 min. away and explore the town. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Both slept well and the price can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: MAC111333
Reviews.Content: Being a research buff, I discovered this motel after a lot of digging -- wanting to simply find a clean motel at an affordable price. After staying here for 3 nights with my 21-year-old daughter, we both agreed we'd prefer staying here again over the Hotel Circle facility stayed at 3 months ago (which was slightly higher in price). Depending on what you're looking for in a room, the price cannot be beat for what you get (comparing it with San Diego's high prices) -- a clean, comfortable bed (pillow-top in the upgraded rooms); clean room; manicured lawn; and a central location with quick access to/from I-8. Be aware, however, that small amenities are not provided in room -- coffee pot, hair dryer, or iron/ironing board -- so either bring what you can from home or borrow from the office. Noise level (next door neighbor's t.v. or maid's cart wheeling by on sidewalk) was dealt with by turning on the heat/air conditioner unit, which runs constantly while on ... a benefit! ... (versus the "on-and-off, on-and off" type of unit which can disturb your sleep). We'll definitely consider staying here again on a return trip. I chose to rate it "above average" WHEN COMPARING IT WITH other hotels at the same price ... due to the PLUS factors (comfortable bed; clean room; central location). It's otherwise just an average motel ... nothing fancy. If you're looking for atmosphere, check elsewhere and pay the price! I'll spend the money saved on healthy, delicious food!

HotelInfo.Name: Heritage Inn - Sea World San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 3333 Channel Way, San Diego, CA 92110
